ν The same road which had been the scene of these events became always liable to the incur- sions of the savageS, and proved fatal to many who journeyed there. Alarcon, Las Tres Cruzes‚ La Viuda, Las Sepulturas, Don Gil, Dona Lo- renza, and other places near the river Salado, are wont to inspire terror by recalling the me- mory of the numerous slaughters perpetrated there. Throughout these extensive tracts of land, estates once fiourished opulent in cattle, which being laid waste by the savageS, a mourn- ful solitude‚ opportune for plunderers, had suc- ceeded. Hence the road hanging over the river Salado was deserted by the St. lagans, who, for the sake of security, thought proper to frequent another, named El camino de los porongos.
